position: Intern - Data Science Project Analyst - Summer 2022 - CO or Remote/Nationwide
description: ABOUT LUMEN Lumen is guided by our belief that humanity is at its best when technology advances the way we live and work. With 450,000 route fiber miles serving customers in more than 60 countries, we deliver the fastest, most secure global platform for applications and data to help businesses, government and communities deliver amazing experiences. Learn more about Lumen’s network, edge cloud, security and communication and collaboration solutions and our purpose to further human progress through technology at news.lumen.com, LinkedIn: /lumentechnologies, Twitter: @lumentechco, Facebook: /lumentechnologies, Instagram: @lumentechnologies and YouTube: /lumentechnologies. THE ROLE Lumen’s Internship Program is a path for career readiness in the 4th Industrial Revolution.  Be a part of an internship program, driving human progress through technology.  During a 10- week period our summer interns innovate and make an impact by transforming industries across the globe and changing the world one connection at a time.  Our interns are presented with real business challenges and provide solutions that make a difference across all areas of the company, all while learning the skills needed to successfully navigate the modern workplace. The Experience  •    Innovate – to deliver solutions to real business problems  •    Transform – your skills and knowledge through challenging work projects •    Connect – to our company and culture creating valuable connections with your intern peers, work team and leaders across the organization. •    Impact – through Community & Social Involvement – collaborate with our ERGs to give back and make an impact in the communities Lumen serves.   THE MAIN RESPONSIBILITIES As a Data Science Project Analyst intern in our North American Operations organization, you will work collaboratively with our Team to model and build frameworks and develop business applications and provide insights. Tasks during the 10 weeks may include: Define project/program objectives and milestones, track work progress, coordinate and solicit inputs from field leaders, document outcomes, perform data science tasks such as identifying and sourcing data, do database processing, perform analytical or statistical modeling, simulate outcomes, communicate findings and provide business insights. You will need a high level of engagement and ability to take initiative, ask questions, learn quickly, and work in a team environment. Potential projects may include: •    Help with creating a capital efficiency model to determine and reduce cost per enabled household  •    Look at investments to ensure Lumen is spending correctly •    Ensure capital and operational efficiency  •    Provide insights on opportunities for scaling, bring problem solving designs to leadership board   WHAT WE LOOK FOR IN A CANDIDATE -    Education Requirements  -    Enrolled at a 4-year accredited college or university- rising senior status at the start of the internship, graduating August 2022 – May 2023. -    Major/Degree: In pursuit of degree in Business Analytics, Project Management, Computer Science, MIS, Accounting, Finance, or a related field. -    Proficiency and understanding of: -    Microsoft Suites  -    SQL experience is a must -    Python is a plus -    R background is a plus -    Professional Attributes  -    Strong drive for results/solutions and taking initiative to resolve problems -    Comfortable calling and asking for information  -    Desire to be mentored, molded, and work in a team environment  -    Ability to communicate extremely well is necessary -    Ability to be resourceful and adaptable- independently AND in a team environment  -    Ability to collaborate and have agility while making effective decisions -    Strong written and verbal communication skills  -    Capable of relaying output in a professional manner to internal and external leadership teams  -    Work Setting -    Ideally the position will be in one of the following offices: Littleton, CO or Remote/Work From Home -    Intern must be able to work 30-40 hours be week during the 10-week program (June – August) -    Intern must have reliable transportation to/from work location (Lumen does not provide transportation to/from Lumen office locations) -    US work authorization  WHAT TO EXPECT NEXT After completion and submission of your application, you will be asked to participate in a virtual video interview. This on demand interview will be a way for Lumen to learn more about you and your experience as it aligns to the internship position.  A separate email invitation will be sent to you (check your spam) within 6 hours of application.  For continued consideration in the summer internship program, please ensure you complete the video interview within 5 business days of application.  Thank you! Requisition #: 263984 EEO STATEMENT We are committed to providing equal employment opportunities to all persons regardless of race, color, ancestry, citizenship, national origin, religion, veteran status, disability, genetic characteristic or information, age, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, marital status, family status, pregnancy, or other legally protected status (collectively, “protected statuses”).  We do not tolerate unlawful discrimination in any employment decisions, including recruiting, hiring, compensation, promotion, benefits, discipline, termination, job assignments or training. DISCLAIMER The above job definition information has been designed to indicate the general nature and level of work performed by employees within this classification. It is not designed to contain or be interpreted as a comprehensive inventory of all duties, responsibilities, and qualifications required of employees assigned to this job.  Job duties and responsibilities are subject to change based on changing business needs and conditions.

About Clearwater Analytics� Clearwater Analytics� is a global SaaS solution for automated investment data aggregation, reconciliation, accounting, and reporting. Clearwater helps thousands of organizations make the most of investment portfolio data with cloud-native software and client-centric servicing. Every day, investment professionals worldwide trust Clearwater to deliver timely, validated investment data and in-depth reporting. Clearwater aggregates, reconciles, and reports on more than $3 trillion in assets across thousands of accounts daily for our Fortune 500 clients. DESCRIPTION Our Summer internship experience is unique to Clearwater. We'll give you two experienced lead developers who will be your mentors, guides and teachers throughout the summer, as well as access to all our full-time development teams. We treat our interns just like our full-time employees. Within the first week you'll learn and put into practice the methods we use every day to work together effectively to create and build a world-class awesome financial software. Before the end of the summer, you'll have created something with your team to be really proud of. All of that and we pay you a top-notch competitive wage for your field! Responsibilities Strong problem-solving skills Working towards Computer Science or related degree Motivated, team player Someone who isn't afraid to say I don't know, let's figure it out! REQUIREMENTS Current students pursuing a four-year degree in Computer Science, Math, or related What you'll get from us: Opportunity to work for the fastest growing technology firm in Idaho Exposure to new technologies, skills and software tools (Agile development, Java, SQL, front end, back end, everything in between) Opportunity to work on real projects and write code that will be used by our clients and contribute to the company's bottom line The chance to work with CS students from all over the country Pair programming Trainings presented by experienced, full-time developers Great work culture with a driven, low key, work and life balanced environment Flexible work hours (it's the summer, after all. We work hard but we have fun too) Freedom to be creative Intern summer events Competitive wages

Hi everyone. First and foremost, we want to stress that this internship provides a great learning experience to all our interns in a highly positive environment. In fact, last summer our internships were ranked #6 in the nation.

SocialTech Labs brings together passionate, creative, young individuals across the globe to help build our upcoming social media app: BestFriends, a closed social networking app promoting positivity in a magically safe place (especially helpful on difficult days) with your 5 best friends. Interns would work with other interns and teen team leaders (https://socialtechlabs.com/team/).

We are a virtual company using Skype as our primary method of day-to-day communication. In addition, we have weekly Zoom calls.

**The DT Intern Scholars Program is designed for undergraduate sophomores who self-identify as Black/African American and or Hispanic/Latinx.** The program is a multi-year experience exposing students to different roles within the tech industry. It will provide participants with knowledge and training to strengthen technical and communication skills while building business acumen and providing visibility to career opportunities. As a DT Intern Scholar, you will have two internship opportunities to work in a high-performing team and provide solutions to our customers’ most complex issues. Each summer, you will be assigned an innovative project where you can quickly ramp and make real contributions. Whether delivering tools / features, testing a new product, enhancing inventory management controls or working with teams that support our customers daily, you will learn what it’s like to work in a fast-pasted organization that provides leading edge solutions to customer challenges. You’ll have opportunities to interact with leaders, other summer interns and network at professional development and social events. At the end of your tenure you’ll share what you’ve accomplished. Upon successful completion of the first DT Intern Scholars internship, students may receive a second DT Scholars internship offer. Those who successfully complete all DT Scholars internships and maintain high academic achievement may receive full-time job offers. **Program Internship Offerings** DT Intern Scholars internship roles are available across several of Dell’s business units within the Products and Operations organization. We offer internships in 5 areas and details can be found below. **1. Infrastructure Solutions Group (ISG): Engineering Intern **(Internship locations: Austin, TX; Hopkinton, MA; Santa Clara, CA; Seattle, WA, Remote) ++What You’ll Do++: The Infrastructure Solutions Group (ISG) at Dell Technologies delivers the essential infrastructure for organizations to build their digital future, transform IT from core to cloud to edge and protect their most important asset: information! As an ISG Engineering Intern, you will focus on the future needs of our business and our customers through a communities of practice internship model. You and your intern team will drive an end to end project connected towards one of our community themes, with support from a project lead, community members and subject matter experts in the business. ++Who You Are++: Working towards a Computer Science, Computer/Software Engineering, Electrical Engineering or Technology related degree | Understanding of Computer Science/Computer Engineering Foundations **2. Client Solutions Group: Engineering Intern** (Internship locations: Austin, TX; Hopkinton, MA, Remote) ++What You’ll Do++: Deliver the essential commercial, consumer, gaming and software solutions to individuals and organization across the globe and offer great opportunities to deliver innovation across cloud services, security, hardware, and software solutions. As a Software Engineering Intern, you will innovate, design, implement and debug modules and infrastructure created for our next generation product offering. ++Who You Are++: Working towards a Bachelor’s degree in the following Majors- ME, Thermal, CE, EE, IT, MIS, CS, Computing or similar fields. | for Software positions you will need proficiency in at least one of C/C++/Java/JavaScript/ Python/Node.js | Hands-on implementation experience in data structures, algorithms, and OS | Working knowledge of Linux systems, distributed systems, and cloud-related environments | For Hardware you will need proficiency in any of the design software: Creo, Fusion, ANSYS, and/or Flotherm XT/Flotherm computational fluid dynamics simulation software. (Equivalent tool experience is acceptable) **3. Client Solutions Group: Marketing Intern** (Internship locations: Round Rock, TX, Remote) ++What You’ll Do++: Gain real Marketing business experience and get project-based roles throughout North America Marketing Operations (COC) organization. Develop project plans/schedules, define project requirements, manage communications, and report on project status. ++Who You Are++: Working towards a Bachelor’s degree with concentration in Marketing, Business Administration, Business Management, Economics, Business Analytics, Finance or other related discipline. **4. Client Solutions Group: Sales Intern** (Internship locations: Round Rock, TX, Remote) ++What You’ll Do++: Support a key business initiative for our inside sales team and work with Inside Sales Managers and Director on a special project that will impact the organization. ++Who You Are++: Working towards a Bachelor’s degree in Business Administration, Business Management, or other related discipline | Strong Organizational, analytical, problem solving, negotiation, and planning skills | Experience with Excel, PowerPoint is a plus. **5. Global Operations/Supply Chain Intern** (Internship locations: Austin, TX or Hopkinton, MA, Remote) ++What You’ll Do++: Join a world-class Global Operations supply chain where you can drive lasting change while building a long-term career. Interns work in different areas (e.g., procurement, manufacturing & operations, logistics) of Global Operations and all interns are expected to complete analysis and present results / recommendations to management on summer projects. ++Who You Are++: Working towards a Bachelor’s degree in Supply Chain Management, Logistics, Industrial and Systems Engineering or applicable field.

Job Description: The software development intern will work directly with our professional app developers and assist with a wide variety of projects as it relates to the TurnUp mobile and web app. The intern will report directly to members of our app development team.

TurnUp is looking for a few software engineering volunteers to contribute to our mobile and web app and help on a few other initiatives.

Interns will learn about progressive organizing, start-ups, partnerships, marketing, and about the non-profit, civic technology and progressive space.

If you possess any of the requirements below, we are very excited to hear from you, but it is not required that you possess one of these: * 1+ years of software development experience in a javascript heavy environment * 1+ years of experience with react-native, react-bootstrap, or react * 1+ years of experience in developing firebase functions in javascript or typescript * 1+ Experience in software architecture, planning and management * 1+ years of test engineering experience with of the following: mocha, jest, or similar * 1+ years of experience in developing RESTful APIs (preferably in javascript)

Here is some information about TurnUp:

At TurnUp (www.turnup.us), we are a collaborative workspace that believes in the power that young people can have when they are civically engaged. We believe that everyone should be able to access their activist potential, and that communication creates power. We hope to make the world just, fair and equitable for all, by engaging young people in our democracy.

This is an unpaid internship.

Interns will have the opportunity to work remotely and interact with the nonprofit technology community. Interns will have access to our illustrious advisory board, and make a real impact on youth voter turnout to further progressive change. Time commitment is negotiable.

Marine Science & Education Virtual/Remote Internship

Our team focuses on ecological restoration, community engagement, and research that ultimately protects our waterways and coastal environments. Historically, we have run field trips and volunteer days in the Gloucester area and performed a series of field projects including plastic and invasive mitigation, sea level rise data collection, and others.  In the face of the COVID-19 pandemic, we have implemented more virtual programming to involve our community in a meaningful and safe way. The ideal MS&E intern should be passionate about sustainability and knowledgeable about current issues related to our environment.

MS&E initiatives include: creating educational materials to facilitate citizen science, assisting in research for the Chebacco Lake restoration work, mitigating marine debris via various initiatives, collaborating with other Seaside teams, and more!

Desired skills: 

Outstanding writing and communication skills
Ability to work in a collaborative and interpersonal environment 
Must be able to perform literature reviews and extensive research into a wide range of topics
Should be able to organize and write about advanced scientific information for the general public 
Knowledge of how and when to cite sources (APA preferred)

Desired experience include: 

Research (preferably in STEM) 
Performance of scientific literature reviews and interaction with academic publications
Courses in environmental science, sustainability, or environmental justice 
Jobs in sustainability
Experience creating educational materials for children
ArcGIS experience is a bonus!

position: Intern - Data Scientist - Summer 2022- CO or Nationwide
description: ABOUT LUMEN Lumen is guided by our belief that humanity is at its best when technology advances the way we live and work. With 450,000 route fiber miles serving customers in more than 60 countries, we deliver the fastest, most secure global platform for applications and data to help businesses, government and communities deliver amazing experiences. Learn more about Lumen’s network, edge cloud, security and communication and collaboration solutions and our purpose to further human progress through technology at news.lumen.com, LinkedIn: /lumentechnologies, Twitter: @lumentechco, Facebook: /lumentechnologies, Instagram: @lumentechnologies and YouTube: /lumentechnologies. THE ROLE Lumen’s Internship Program is a path for career readiness in the 4th Industrial Revolution.  Be a part of an internship program, driving human progress through technology.  During a 10- week period our summer interns innovate and make an impact by transforming industries across the globe and changing the world one connection at a time.  Our interns are presented with real business challenges and provide solutions that make a difference across all areas of the company, all while learning the skills needed to successfully navigate the modern workplace. The Experience  -    Innovate – to deliver solutions to real business problems  -    Transform – your skills and knowledge through challenging work projects -    Connect – to our company and culture creating valuable connections with your intern peers, work team and leaders across the organization. -    Impact – through Community & Social Involvement – collaborate with our ERGs to give back and make an impact in the communities Lumen serves. THE MAIN RESPONSIBILITIES As a Data Scientist in our North America Operations organization, the Intern will work to develop and program methods, automated processes, and systems to cleanse, integrate and analyze structured and unstructured, diverse “big data” sources to generate actionable insights and solutions using machine learning and advanced analytics. Tasks during the 10 weeks will include researching and crunching data to assist with system automation. The ideal intern will have technical skills with common languages in the industry.  You will need a high level of engagement and ability to take initiative, ask questions and work in a team environment. -    Interprets and communicates insights and findings from analyses and experiments to other analysts, data scientists, team members and business partners.  -    Design working models and implement them on Big Data systems using Map Reduce or Spark frameworks. -    Assist with operationalizing the solutions and changing business processes to maximize the value of those solutions.  -    Identify patterns and leverage information discovered to create a more automated environment  WHAT WE LOOK FOR IN A CANDIDATE - EDUCATION REQUIREMENTS  -    Enrolled at a 4-year accredited college or university, rising senior or master’s level education status at the start of the internship, graduating August 2022 – May 2023. -    Major/Degree: In pursuit of degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Machine learning, Advanced Analytics, or similar technical degree field. -    PROFICIENCY AND UNDERSTANDING OF: -    Able to apply techniques such as classification, clustering, regression, deep learning, association, anomaly detection, time series forecasting, Hidden Markov models and Bayesian inference to solve pragmatic business problems -    Basic Experience with big data systems and basic programming languages -    Familiar with Hadoop, Pig, Hive, Scope, Cosmos, or similar technologies. -    Experience with statistical programming environments like Python, R, SPSS or IBM Watson Studio  -    Fluent in one or more object oriented-languages like C#, C++, Scala, Java, and scripting languages like Python or Ruby   -    Experience with PowerBI and sparking graphs -    PROFESSIONAL ATTRIBUTES  -    Strong self-drive for results and taking initiative -    Ability to show and present on data -    Comfort in speaking to those in leadership roles -    Strong ability to analyze -    Ability to be resourceful and adaptable -    Ability to collaborate and have agility while making effective decisions -    Strong written and verbal communication skills -    Ability to interact with business partners and drive the conversation -    Self driven-works with minimal supervision -    Flexible and adapts well to change -    WORK SETTING -    Ideally the position will be in one of the following offices: Broomfield -CO, Littleton-CO,  or may consider remote/ work from home. -    Intern must be able to work 30-40 hours per week during the 10-week program (June – August) -    Intern must have reliable transportation to/from work location (Lumen does not provide transportation to/from Lumen office locations) -    US work authorization  WHAT TO EXPECT NEXT After completion and submission of your application, you will be asked to participate in a virtual video interview. This on demand interview will be a way for Lumen to learn more about you and your experience as it aligns to the internship position.  A separate email invitation will be sent to you (check your spam) within 6 hours of application.  For continued consideration in the summer internship program, please ensure you complete the video interview within 5 business days of application.  Thank you! We do not tolerate unlawful discrimination in any employment decisions, including recruiting, hiring, compensation, promotion, benefits, discipline, termination, job assignments or training. We're currently seeking an Accounting major with minor or emphasis in Management Information Systems or Computer Science to become part of our team.

What you'll do

Demonstrate a clear pride of ownership for the team-owned applications.

Assist with the maintenance, administration and support of Finance Systems, and ancillary systems, in alignment w/ Finance programs, goals and initiatives.

Assist with developing, defining, and documenting business requirements that describe the business need and solution scope, and communicate them effectively to IT, HR, and business stakeholders within Treasury, Internal Audit, Tax, etc. 

Assist with the system configurations and maintenance, development and maintenance of a reporting repository and support reporting and analytics requests.

Contribute to the maintenance and accuracy of systems data, in the form of data loads and audits.

Required skills:

Bachelor's degree in MIS or Computer Science, Finance or Business Administration or an equivalent combination of education.

Strong analytical skills, excellent communication skills (written and oral).ra

A working knowledge of one of more of the following applications desirable: DB2, Cognos Analytics, SPSS, JIRA, Slack, Splunk, advanced Excel, Robotic Process Automation, and other new technology data analytics tools.

Job Type: Internship

The intern term is 3 to 6 months. This is a non-paid internship, with flexible hours (minimum of 16 hours per week) to reflect your necessary college credit requirements. If the intern could hold the position very well, we may be able to offer a more full or part-time position with compensation.

As part of the application process, please answer all the questions given below:

Are you aware that this is an unpaid intern position? 

How many hours a week can you commit? (all activity is virtual) 

How many months would you like to intern with youbloom? 

Do you have any experience in the music industry? 

Why do you believe you will be a good fit for this position? 

Do you have any current obligations that might affect your ability to meet deadlines? 

Do you have the ability to work autonomously, and collaborate with a team? Explain? 

Could you provide details of what your college requires from youbloom for you to intern with us? 

What is it about youbloom’s values and vision/mission that appeal to you? (About youbloom http://www.youbloom.com/about/ ) 

What are your 5 favorite songs? (optional) 

Your top 5 bands/artists? (optional)

position: Virgin Islands - Research Intern (Culture and Science)
description:
This internship offers the opportunity to help conduct field research in U.S. Virgin Islands with one of our research teams. This expedition will focus on conducting marine life surveys, plant surveys, wildlife surveys, as well as capturing information on the local culture and history. This research will be completed while living aboard our 44' catamaran and sailing around the archipelago.

Intern will complete pre-trip investigative research, conduct action research for 1 week in U.S. Virgin Islands and spend 1-3 months wrapping up your research from your home or university during the summer or fall semester.

++**Who we are and what we do**++ Momentive (NASDAQ: MNTV) (formerly SurveyMonkey) is a leader in agile experience management, delivering powerful, purpose-built solutions that bring together the best parts of humanity and technology to redefine AI. Momentive products, including [++GetFeedback++](https://www.getfeedback.com/), [++SurveyMonkey++](https://www.momentive.ai/?ut_source2=en%2Fcareers%2F3479904-software-engineer&ut_source3=inline), and its [++brand and market insights++](https://www.momentive.ai/insights/?ut_source2=en%2Fcareers%2F3479904-software-engineer&ut_source3=inline) solutions, empower decision-makers at 345,000 organizations worldwide to shape exceptional experiences. Ultimately, the company's vision is to raise the bar for human experiences by amplifying individual voices. Learn more at Momentive.ai. ++**The Role**++ As a Software Engineer Intern, you'll have the opportunity to contribute to our products alongside our full time Engineering teams. You’ll have the opportunity to build out a solution while working on a frontend or backend project, or even work on a project that spans both. You’ll be given all of the tools necessary to be successful while learning from talented engineers in a welcoming and constructive environment. During your summer here, you’ll have a dedicated mentor and manager to support you throughout the program. Our interns are invited to social and developmental events which provide accessibility to leadership, social responsibility and team building opportunities.

description:
Clojure Developer - Remote

This is a contract remote role expected at 40hrs/week

About ThorTech Solutions:

ThorTech Solutions is a software development and IT consultancy that specializes in coming up with creative solutions in the cloud, specifically AWS. We utilize new technology and techniques to enable our clients to do things today that they couldn’t do yesterday.

About the Client:

The client is a SaaS firm that provides cloud data integration and validation solutions for industries such as telecommunication, retail, and healthcare.

About the Role:

As a Clojure Developer, you’ll be responsible for software design, implementation, testing, and operation. You’ll collaborate with other software engineers, quality assurance engineers, product managers, and product designers to participate in the full software development lifecycle – from product requirements to software design to testing and release.

The team uses Clojure, Java, Python, ES6, and React. They run on AWS. Experience with these technologies is not required but is considered a plus.

Requirements:

2+ years experience with Clojure
Experience with programming languages such as Java and/or Python
Familiarity with basic data structures and algorithms
Knowledge of web applications, databases, Linux, and cloud environments
A track record of delivering substantial software projects in cloud or SaaS products
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills

Highly Desirable:

AWS Experience
Experience with other functional programming languages (Scala, Haskell, LISP, etc.)
Experience with React

Job Types: Full-time, Contract, Internship

Pay: $27,345.00 - $92,868.00 per year

Schedule:

8 hour shift

Work Location:

Multiple locations

Work Remotely:

Yes

Interns will contribute meaningfully to a team that builds technology products. Although we are accepting resumes, we will not be reviewing them from this job posting regularly. EXPERIENCE: Minimum Experience: General knowledge of the Software Development Life Cycle (SDLC), computer information systems, and Agile approach. Knowledge of computers: preferably Microsoft packages and advancement in programming language learning. Preferred Experience: Previous experience in creating and deploying software (e.g. internship, class-based project, personal project, research opportunity, non-profit work, etc.) Experience solving complex problems and working through challenging requirements COMPETENCIES SKILLS/KNOWLEDGE/ABILITIES: Motivated and excited by technical challenges Passionate about collaborating with teammates and customers Demonstrates an eagerness to learn and enjoys helping others Shares new ideas, is creative and passionate about innovation Detail oriented and cares about creating an exceptional user experience Exceptional written, verbal and interpersonal skills Comfortable working in an agile development environment and understands on time/within-budget principles. PLEASE APPLY ON OUR APPLICATION PAGE: https://www.nstem.org/internships

Questions: Please contact us @ internships@nstem.org 

Website & Technology: NSTEM is built on the Wordpress platform, needing constant updates. We are looking for Innovators, problem solvers and tech-savvy interns to join NSTEM’s Tech Team. Tech team is a group of NSTEM interns that have a knack for technology use and are adept at helping others. 

These interns are problem solvers, critical thinkers, and enjoy staying on top of new technologies and best practices that will drive the mission of NSTEM. They should be able to troubleshoot issues and serve as the front line for tech support issues such as logins and will aid with GSuite apps for our global users. Tech Team members are innovators and come up with ways to expand the knowledge and confidence of all NSTEM’s constituents. 

SKILLS REQUIRED: 

Experience with HTML and/or CSS strongly preferred
Customer service 
Tech support 
Proficiency with Google Suite
Strong communication
Experience with digital marketing, change management, user experience, and/or web design 
Willingness to collaborate and a team-oriented mindset

This unpaid internship can be fulfilled virtually from anywhere around the globe; currently all in-person opportunities are on hold.  

The National STEM Honor Society™ (NSTEM™) was founded in response to the growing demand for innovative STEM education, to help fill this gap, providing students from a very young age with opportunities to develop their passion for STEM disciplines, inspiring them to pursue these subjects as careers and as lifelong interests. NSTEM establishes chapters in schools that provide STEM activities and resources for students to engage in to help them see their potential and become career-ready for STEM fields.

NSTEM’s Three Areas of Focus:

Enroll NSTEM Chapters across the nation as quickly as possible by reaching out to educators, education departments and synergistic organizations,
Attract corporate sponsors and foundation grants to provide funding to various NSTEM chapters,
Reach out and attract strategic partners and advisory council members.

Duration Requirements: This job may be posted with definitive start and end dates, these are merely guidelines, internships can be offered anytime throughout the year! Whether the internship is for credit or not, National STEM Honor Society (NSTEM) hires interns for a minimum of 240 total hours with no maximum, and a 4 month (15 hour/week) minimum.  

Supervision & Mentoring: All interns working for NSTEM will be mentored and supervised by our staff. Directors and Project Managers offer diverse educational backgrounds and expertise within their respective fields. Staff members provide opportunities for interns to work on projects that align with their learning goals with evaluation and constructive feedback along the way. 

Market Research: To meet our weekly goals of outreach to these educators, all NSTEM interns are required to spend no more than 2-hours a week collecting this critical and game changing information. When you are researching these educators, you are literally selecting the people who will be changing the lives of their students by taking part in the National STEM Honor Society. 

Synchronous Meetings, Asynchronous Work: At NSTEM, interns need to attend any synchronous meetings as requested by management. NSTEM meetings are typically held between 8 AM - 5:30 PM EST. Outside of these informative meetings, interns can complete their work at their own pace.

To learn more about NSTEM:

Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/nstemhs

2022 Summer Internship Program - Technology About IHS Markit At the heart of IHS Markit, we are an information company. With expertise across the world's largest industries, we leverage technology and data science, to provide the insights, software, and data to help our customers make better informed decisions, driving growth, performance, and efficiency. 2022 Intern Program - Opportunities for students During your internship you'll have the chance to partner with our industry experts, with on the job experience focusing on high impact work that allows you to apply and develop your skills. Networking, business insights and tailored learning opportunities all support your growth and development, setting you up for success as you begin your career. Eligibility Our next internship program runs through the summer of 2022. We're looking for students who are working towards a Bachelor's or Master's degree (or equivalent), and due to complete their studies to be available for a full time role commencing in 2023. The role As an Intern with IHS Markit, you will undertake work on a real business projects intended to add value to the team as well as provide you with a great learning opportunity.Upon completion of the internship, you will have an understanding of how data plays a critical part in making key business decisions in several industries and how this adds value to our customers. You will see how the business and technical side of application development come together to create impactful and actionable information and how the technology is maintained and developed in order to keep it competitive in the marketplace. If you are passionate about solving challenging technical problems and have a desire to work in technology, this is the stream for you. Opportunities within this stream include, but are not limited to: Software Engineer Software Development What we're looking for We seek candidates with diverse backgrounds and ideas with a desire to learn and thrive. The Summer Internship Program will provide a variety of experiences to help you identify your strengths, develop highly transferable skills, and align you to a successful career path for a bright future at IHS Markit. To be an ideal fit for the role, you should have: A bachelor or master's degree (or equivalent) completed no later than May 2023 0-6 months relevant work experience Demonstrated passion or interest in one or more of our key industries Excellent communication skills Strong critical thinking and problem-solving skills An aptitude to learn and adapt quickly in a rapidly changing environment The ability to build strong working relationships in a collaborative setting Be legally eligible to work for the duration of the program in the country for which you apply For Technology applicants, we recommend the following: Currently studying in an area of computer science or similar degree Experience with coding languages such as Java, SQL, or Python An understanding and/or interest in any of the following; Software development methodologies Quality assurance Infrastructure Microsoft technologies Relational databases Java based technologies Ability to convey complex subject matter clearly and engagingly Proficient with MS Office Knowledge of object-oriented concepts and techniques Application and assessment process The assessment process that follows is designed to ensure you can learn more about us, showcase your skills, and find a role that is right for you. Stage 1: Submit online application Stage 2: Online pymetrics assessment Stage 3: Initial screening process Stage 4: Final stage assessment day You may be considered for multiple suitable roles throughout this process. If these roles fall within the same stream, you will be assessed during the same process. If the roles fall across multiple streams, you may be asked to complete different assessments aligned to those roles. position: Intern - Data Analyst - Summer 2022- Nationwide or LA
description: ABOUT LUMEN Lumen is guided by our belief that humanity is at its best when technology advances the way we live and work. With 450,000 route fiber miles serving customers in more than 60 countries, we deliver the fastest, most secure global platform for applications and data to help businesses, government and communities deliver amazing experiences. THE ROLE Lumen’s Internship Program is a path for career readiness in the 4th Industrial Revolution.  Be a part of an internship program, driving human progress through technology.  During a 10- week period our summer interns innovate and make an impact by transforming industries across the globe and changing the world one connection at a time.  Our interns are presented with real business challenges and provide solutions that make a difference across all areas of the company, all while learning the skills needed to successfully navigate the modern workplace. The Experience  -    Innovate – to deliver solutions to real business problems  -    Transform – your skills and knowledge through challenging work projects -    Connect – to our company and culture creating valuable connections with your intern peers, work team and leaders across the organization. -    Impact – through Community & Social Involvement – collaborate with our ERGs to give back and make an impact in the communities Lumen serves.   THE MAIN RESPONSIBILITIES As a Data Analyst intern in our North American Operations organization, you will work collaboratively with our Dispatch and Capacity Planning Organization Team to support the planning and execution of dispatching over 6,000 of our Consumer and Small Business Technicians and over 1,000 of our National Enterprise Technicians Tasks during the 10 weeks may include gathering data and analytics to assist the team in making business decisions and actions. You will need a high level of engagement and ability to take initiative, ask questions, learn quickly, and work in a team environment. Other tasks may include: -    Acquiring data from other sources, creating reports on a regular basis, correcting any issues, and ensuring that databases remain error-free and organized  -    Gather data specifically on Quantum fiber  -    Spot trends and anomalies within statistical data, to include using reporting and statistics tools  -    Conduct capacity planning  -    Work with various software packages, from reporting tools to statistical applications.  Strong job candidates will need to be able to quickly pick up new computer programs and use them efficiently  -    Strong job candidates will need to be able to quickly pick up new computer programs and use them efficiently   WHAT WE LOOK FOR IN A CANDIDATE -    Education Requirements  -    Enrolled at a 4-year accredited college or university- rising senior or masters level status at the start of the internship, graduating August 2022 – May 2023. -    Major/Degree: In pursuit of degree in Data Science, Business Analytics, Computer Science, MIS, or a related field. -    Proficiency and understanding of: -    Microsoft Suites  -    Statistical and analytical tools (e.g., Microsoft Power BI, Excel, Access, SQL)  -    Reporting and publishing tools (e.g., Microsoft Power Point, Visio, SharePoint, Teams)  -    Python -    Report writing skills – have experience with preparing reports for multiple levels of the organization -    Professional Attributes  -    Strong drive for results/solutions and taking initiative to resolve problems -    Comfortable approaching teammates, leadership, and building cross departmental relationships -    High attention to detail with STRONG organizational skills -    Ability to balance multiple projects at one time -    Ability to communicate extremely well  -    Ability to be resourceful and adaptable- independently AND in a team environment  -    Desire to collaborate with team and have agility while making effective decisions -    Strong written and verbal communication skills  -    Self-starter with a positive attitude -    Strong mathematical skills  -    Work Setting -    Ideally the position will be in one of the following offices: Monroe, LA or Remote/Work From Home -    Intern must be able to work 30-40 hours be week during the 10-week program (June – August) -    Intern must have reliable transportation to/from work location (Lumen does not provide transportation to/from Lumen office locations) -    US work authorization    WHAT TO EXPECT NEXT After completion and submission of your application, you will be asked to participate in a virtual video interview. This on demand interview will be a way for Lumen to learn more about you and your experience as it aligns to the internship position.  A separate email invitation will be sent to you (check your spam) within 6 hours of application.  For continued consideration in the summer internship program, please ensure you complete the video interview within 5 business days of application.  Thank you! Headquartered in Palo Alto, CA, TIBCO Software enables businesses to reach new heights on their path to digital distinction and innovation. From systems to devices and people, we interconnect everything, capture data in real time wherever it is, and augment the intelligence of organizations through analytical insights. Thousands of customers around the globe rely on us to build compelling experiences, energize operations, and propel innovation.   Our teams flourish on new ideas and welcome individuals who thrive in transforming challenges into opportunities. From designing and building amazing products to providing excellent service; we encourage and are shaped by bold thinkers, problem-solvers, and self-starters.  We are always adapting and providing exciting opportunities for our employees to grow, learn and excel. We value the customers and employees that define who we are; dynamic individuals willing to take the risks necessary to make big ideas come to life and who are comfortable collaborating in our creative, optimistic environment. TIBCO – we are just scratching the surface. ### **Overview** The TIBCO Information Security Team works with teams from across TIBCO, including engineering, cloud operations, IT, legal and sales, to ensure continuous improvement in our security posture. The Security Team’s efforts directly affect both TIBCO corporate and our customers. The team has a diverse set of responsibilities to ensure that risks that affect TIBCO customers as well as TIBCO itself are identified and remediated. This opportunity is for a self-starting individual to join a professional corporate information security team and participate in all areas of information security including risk assessment, requirements analysis, secure design principles, secure software development and validation, and communications. ### **What You'll Do** ●      Assess internal security processes, recommend changes or enhancements for identified security gaps, and implement recommendations ●      Align security standards, frameworks and policies with overall business and technology strategy ●      Work across the company to identify and implement privacy requirements ●      Collaborate with developers and other internal groups to identify, prioritize and develop improvements to secure software development tooling and practices, including our application security automation tooling ●      Work together with cross functional teams of Software Developers, Systems and Network Administrators, and others to improve the security of TIBCO product offerings ●      Make improvements to the open-source vulnerability management software built in Python/Django that we use to aggregate and report on our security findings **What You Will Learn** ●      Information security requirements that affect a multinational software development organization ●      The identification, analysis and prioritization of risks that affect enterprise software development and their associated remediations ●      Industry standards and regulations that affect enterprise information security ●      The tools and technologies that corporate security teams like ours use to manage the complexity of a fast-moving security environment ### **Who You Are** - Pursuing a bachelors or masters degree in Information Security, Computer Science or similar field - Pride yourself on being an excellent communicator - Enthusiastic and driven to learn new concepts and participate as part of a cooperative and professional information security team - Classroom experience or better in programming (e.g. Golang or Java) and scripting languages (e.g. Python, Bash, JavaScript or similar languages) is desired - Successful past internships at enterprise software companies are a plus - Prior compliance, security policy and procedures experience is a plus

The internship term is negotiable. Position can be remote or a combination of the two if approved.

About Futureforce University Recruiting Our Futureforce University Recruiting program is dedicated to attracting, retaining and cultivating talent. Our interns and new graduates work on real projects that affect how our business runs, giving them the opportunity to make a tangible impact on the future of our company. We offer job shadowing, mentorship programs, talent development courses, and much more. Job Category Intern Job Details MuleSoft's Professional Services team works across every technology to deliver solutions to customers in every industry. As a Delivery Manager (DM) intern on our Services team, you will play an important role in our Services practice growth. MuleSoft is the leader in implementing the application network by connecting data, devices and applications, and we are pursuing people passionate about integration that enables digital transformation. The Delivery Manager interns will manage various internal project tasks and client project tasks under the guidance of an experienced MuleSoft DM. The purposes of the role are for the intern to gain experience, contribute to assigned projects and gain insights into interest in joining the Mulesoft Services team upon graduation. Below are some of the responsibilities that you will carry out in your role as DM Intern: Support MuleSoft DMs on multiple customer projects simultaneously Work closely with Delivery Manager(s) as part of the project team and provide assistance with project team/tasks management and execution Assist in the planning and management of project task executions and communicate status to all stakeholders Assist in the management of MuleSoft issues and risks, tracking and resolution Develop processes, templates, or tools as part of an internal continuous improvement team. What You'll Achieve Gain an understanding of digital transformation and professional services consulting. Real-life, hands on experience with delivering mission critical client projects impacting business and operations. Learn and experience core project management disciplines including the agile framework, risk and issue management, scheduling, tracking, budget management, and more. Complete Mulesoft training including our Mulesoft products, Catalyst methodologies for Services implementations and services offerings. Learn our Services' team internal processes for staffing and resourcing, partner engagement, and the entire lifecycle for managing Mulesoft projects. Complete training to understand the role of each Mulesoft team included in Services engagements - Customer Success, Engagement Management and Account Team. Learn the Catalyst and Center for Enablement methodology for implementing organizational change management jointly with our clients. Contribute to one or more internal projects and/or client-facing engagements Opportunities will be provided for voluntary time off (VTO) for giving back to the community. Learn and experience the unique Salesforce Ohana culture. What You'll Need to be Successful A rising senior (current junior) pursuing a Bachelor's degree with a preferred concentration in Computer Science, Management Information Systems (MIS), Information Systems, Business, or Marketing. Be able work independently and under management's direction Ability to work in a cross-functional team environment Aptitude for an operational and/or technical services role Demonstrate basic knowledge with waterfall and agile methodologies Demonstrate interest in career expansion as a project manager and/or scrum master Ability to work in collaboration with a client project manager or scrum master to lead the implementation through an entire software development lifecycle. Dynamic leadership aptitude Strong Verbal and written communication skills About MuleSoft, a Salesforce company Our mission is to help organizations change and innovate faster by making it easy to connect the world's applications, data, and devices. Companies like Spotify, McDonald's, and Unilever rely on MuleSoft to stay agile, deliver faster, and make the most of their IT investment with API-led connectivity. Hiring exceptional people who want to build a great company together is our number one priority, and we're committed to providing an equal opportunity workplace where everyone is supported and inspired to do their best work. We work tirelessly to build this culture. Companies of every size and industry are using Salesforce to transform their businesses, across sales, service, marketing, commerce, and more by connecting with customers in a whole new way. TIBCO – we are just scratching the surface. **Overview** TIBCO Spotfire Analytics and Data Discovery Platform We are looking for a Cloud Infrastructure Engineering intern to join our analytics and data discovery platform, TIBCO Spotfire, and seize a unique opportunity to be part of one of the fastest growing groups in TIBCO responsible for creating products driven by advanced computational and visual analytics. TIBCO Spotfire is used for analyzing different types of data by our customers from drug research to energy production patterns and sales figures. The Spotfire Engineering Infrastructure team focuses on the design and implementation of scripts and frameworks used to build, deploy, and maintain our products both internally and in Cloud environments. More Information about the company and products can be found at our website: https://www.tibco.com/products/tibco-spotfire **What You'll Do** The internship is designed to equip you with the skills, knowledge, and experience to accelerate your career development through intensive training, practical project work, and access to experienced mentors. You will gain real-world experience deploying our technology and receive regular peer and manager feedback opportunities As a member and intern of the Spotfire Engineering Infrastructure team you will: - Contribute improvements that add meaningful value to the TIBCO Cloud Spotfire deployment infrastructure through design and implementation of self-directed projects with support and mentorship from the team - Proactively solve problems with the help of other members of the team; some that are spread out geographically - Grow your real-world experience with Cloud providers such as AWS and Azure; and deployment orchestration technologies such as Kubernetes and Helm **Who You Are** - Pursuing a BS or a MS in Computer Science or related major - Ability to ramp up quickly and apply new technologies and processes - Working knowledge of Linux and Windows operating systems - Experience with scripting languages such as Python, Windows PowerShell, Unix Shell - Experience with or exposure to deployment, configuration management and monitoring tools on the Cloud, particularly on AWS (ex. Container Management, Logging) - Exceptional motivation, enthusiasm and an aptitude to learn and contribute - Attention to detail and a passion for software quality - Excellent analytical, problem solving, reporting and communication skills - Self-directed with strong time management and organization skills **Additional Desirable Skills** - Familiarity with containerization and Cloud deployment tools (e.g. Docker, Kubernetes, Helm) - Experience with continuous deployment and integration tools (e.g. Jenkins, TeamCity)

Intern, Data Engineer The Job Details are as follows: Overview: We are looking for creative and enthusiastic Data Engineers to join our team in building the best Data Platform on the street. Were responsible for managing the flow of data into the firm, maintaining the data lake, creating analytics-ready datasets, and building the APIs that make everything accessible to our clients. Our singular goal is to help our investment teams use data to make better investment decisions. Our analysts and systematic trading teams rely on us to provide analytics-ready datasets. For each dataset we must consider the implications of point in time storage, optimize for our users access patterns, and create useful aggregations/slices. Our ideal candidate will have experience with storing, transforming, and modeling big data. In this role, you will be exposed to: * Developing cloud-first data ingestion processes using Python, SQL, and Spark * Engineering data models and infrastructure for a wide variety of market and alternative datasets * Designing and building services and plugins to enhance our Data Platform * Maintaining alerting systems to ensure smooth day-to-day operations for hundreds of datasets * Authoring tests to validate data quality and the stability of the platform * Investigating and defusing time-sensitive data incidents * Communicating with data providers to onboard new datasets and troubleshoot technical issues * Evangelizing best practices to our partners throughout the firm What Youll Bring: * A love of data and a passion for engineering * A thousand questions and a drive to exceed expectations * Candidacy for Bachelors/Masters degree in Computer Science, Data Analytics, or a related field * Strong analytical, data, and programming skills (Python/SQL/NoSQL) * Strong oral and written communication skills, most importantly, must be a team player

At NRC Health, we promise to help our customers bring human understanding to healthcare for their patients and communities. Our associates are at the heart of delivering that promise, so we promise that same human understanding to each other. Come where culture is everything. As an associate, you: Innovate with us to move healthcare forward. Give back to the community with volunteer time off. Fit your role and do what you love. Grow and develop along a career path designed by you. Support one another - no one says, That's not my job. Play hard at beer:30 and team outings - we have a lot to celebrate. Let life happen with 4+ weeks' time off, a flexible work environment, and dress for your day attire. Live healthy with a comprehensive healthcare plan and wellness program. Who we want Do you crave an opportunity to build your talents and make a difference? Are you a highly motivated and driven individual looking to kick start your professional career? Do you have a passion to make an impact in a mission-oriented industry? Are you an excellent communicator with strong business writing skills? Think Boldly. Feel Connected. Be Understood.

Preferred Requirements * Active Clearance: TS/SCI * Valid CompTIA Security + certification Physical Requirements Job performance will normally require only minor lifting and carrying of boxes of records or equipment. Building on a legacy of more than a century of naval shipbuilding, Technical Solutions, a division of Huntington Ingalls Industries provides mission-critical solutions to a wide variety of government and commercial customers worldwide. Comprising nearly 6,000 professionals in 45 states and 16 countries, our unique national security services portfolio includes unmanned systems, defense and federal solutions, and nuclear and environmental services. For more information, visit tsd.huntingtoningalls.com. Huntington Ingalls Industries is America's largest military shipbuilding company and a provider of professional services to partners in government and industry. For more than a century, HII's Newport News and Ingalls shipbuilding divisions in Virginia and Mississippi have built more ships in more ship classes than any other U.S. naval shipbuilder. HII's Technical Solutions division supports national security missions around the globe with unmanned systems, nuclear and environmental services, and defense and federal solutions. Headquartered in Newport News, Virginia, HII employs more than 42,000 people operating both domestically and internationally. For more information, visit: www.huntingtoningalls.com . Every day, Pendo's flagship analytics platform processes over 10.5 billion events and creates over 225,000 data analytics results. Every hour we ingest over 100+ million web and mobile events. Then in a fraction of a second we query hundreds of terabytes (or more) of data in order to respond to our users' actionsallowing users to discover valuable insights about their products. Pendo is looking for a dynamic, motivated, and self-driven individual to join our Information Security team this summer as a Security Engineer Intern! Are you passionate about cybersecurity and helping to protect complex cloud-based applications that serve millions of users? If this interests you, this role is for you! We are looking for a Computer Science major (or other technical discipline) interested in working in a fast-paced, rapidly growing tech environment with a complex SaaS application that faces millions of people. In addition to the day-to-day responsibilities this intern will hold, you'll also be provided mentorship and development via one-on-one time with our Chief Information Security Officer and other members of our Information Security team. Responsibilities (what you'll do): Participate as a member of the Information Security team on assigned operational and project-based tasks. Work will be varied and may include the following types of activities: Running and analyzing the results from vulnerability scans Developing scripts to help automate security tasks Reviewing and updating documentation for security policies and procedures Assessing risks and making recommendations for addressing them Educating Pendo staff on security threats, policies, and procedures Assisting with developing threat models for new services and product features Assisting with identifying and responding to potential cyber attacks Qualifications (what you have): Pursuing a degree in Computer Science or other technical discipline. Demonstrated experience, either through coursework, previous work, or self-study, in one or more of the following areas: Scripting and coding to automate systems and security administration tasks (e.g. using a language such as Python) Identifying, assessing, and remediating security vulnerabilities in web applications Securing cloud computing services (SaaS, PaaS, and IaaS) Evaluating risks associated with using third party services Creating and delivering security awareness training Excellent communication and presentation skills. Strong critical thinking and time management capabilities. A passion for learning and a customer-focused mindset. Pendo Description: Pendo was founded in 2013 by former product managers, who combined their heads and hearts to build something they wanted but never had as product managers -- a simple way to understand and attack what truly drives product success. Our mission is to improve society's experience with software. Come join one of the fastest-growing startups, supported by best-in-class institutions like Battery Ventures, Salesforce Ventures, Spark Capital and Meritech. You will gain experience in a diverse and exciting set of technologies and clients and have a real impact on Pendo's future. Our culture is passionate, dynamic, and fun. EEOC We are an equal opportunity employer and believe having diverse teams where everyone brings their whole self to Pendo is key to our success. We welcome all people of different backgrounds, experiences, abilities and perspectives. Accessibility Pendo is committed to working with, and providing access and reasonable accommodation to, applicants with mental and/or physical disabilities. If you think you may require an accommodation for any part of the recruitment process, please send a request to: accommodation@pendo.io. All requests for accommodations are treated discreetly and confidentially, as practical and permitted by law.

Learn more about Lumens network, edge cloud, security and communication and collaboration solutions and our purpose to further human progress through technology at news.lumen.com, LinkedIn: /lumentechnologies, Twitter: @lumentechco, Facebook: /lumentechnologies, Instagram: @lumentechnologies and YouTube: /lumentechnologies. The Role Be a part of an internship program, driving human progress through technology. During a 10- week period our summer interns innovate and make an impact by transforming industries across the globe and changing the world one connection at a time. Our interns are presented with real business challenges and provide solutions that make a difference across all areas of the company, all while learning the skills needed to successfully navigate the modern workplace. The Experience Innovate to deliver solutions to real business problems Transform your skills and knowledge through challenging work projects Connect to our company and culture creating valuable connections with your intern peers, work team and leaders across the organization. Impact through Community & Social Involvement collaborate with our ERGs to give back and make an impact in the communities Lumen serves. The Main Responsibilities As a Project Management Intern in our North America Field Operations & Network Implementation organization, you will work collaboratively with our team to assist customers in activating and testing products and technologies. Tasks during the 10 weeks will have impact on the customers as well as the business. Project Manager interns will have the potential to learn about fiber products, project management, data research, and many other Lumen programs. This will give interns the opportunity to have a customer facing role while also improving the company through research, management, and technical training. Onsite manager will be available for on the job training and coaching of the intern. Assist with our Revenue Acceleration Program This role will provide experience in project management, collaboration, and general business meeting practices. Communicate and coordinate actions across the team based on the data identified. Engage in the active Automation/Transformation projects and provide PM support Provide PM support for select Top 10 projects underway within our organization Engage in Employee Engagement activities Participate in the DIB (Diversity, Inclusion, and Belonging) program Engage in the Training program. Complete entry level virtual lab modules and provide feedback Provide Teams and Sharepoint support Engage in Data Analytics Ride along with the various teams to better understand the team structure and responsibilities Complete a presentation at the end of the internship to summarize the experience and provide feedback What We Look For in a Candidate * Pursuing a Bachelors degree in business or tech related field Telecommunications, Business management, Data Analytics, Computer Science, or similar degree program. * Enrolled at a 4-year accredited college or university; Junior or Senior education status at the start of the internship (graduating August 2022 May 2024). * GPA: 3.0 or higher preferred, not required * If position is in office, must have transportation to/from work daily * Must be available to work 30 40 hours, during the specified 10-week timeframe. * Experience with Microsoft suit is required * General techology knowledge is appreciated * Candidates are expected to exhibit critical thinking skills and time management/prioritization skills. * Work well in collaborative group settings. * Detail oriented. * Able to learn and adapt quickly. * Strong sense of urgency and ability to meet deadlines * Ability to demonstrate ownership and accountability * Ability to collaborate and have agility while making effective decisions * Strong written and verbal communication skills What to Expect Next After completion and submission of your application, you will be asked to participate in a virtual video interview. This on demand interview will be a way for Lumen to learn more about you and your experience as it aligns to the internship position. A separate email invitation will be sent to you (check your spam) within 6 hours of application. For continued consideration in the summer internship program, please ensure you complete the video interview within 5 business days of application. Thank you! INDUSTRY: Information Technology Security

INTERNSHIP AREA AVAILABLE: IT Security Auditing/Pen-Testing

COMPANY: BAI Security                                                         

COMPANY HQ: Schaumburg, IL (National firm, remote workforce)  

ABOUT THIS OPPORTUNITY: Headquartered in the Chicago area is a pure play IT security assessment and compliance auditing firm, ready to give outstanding candidates a tremendous opportunity to learn, grow, and potentially secure full-time employment with our award-winning company.

Established in 2007 and led by our Founding President/CEO Michael Bruck (2021 appointee to the prestigious Forbes Technology Council), BAI Security’s rocket growth is heavily spurred by a global need for highly qualified security assessment professionals… enter our unparalleled team of in-house experts, who’ll be your mentors.

TIMEFRAME: Our internships are available year-round, so candidates are welcome to submit materials on a rolling basis. However, we are currently looking to identify two IT Security here in late 2021 to begin their internship in early 2022 (likely February). Internship length is determined with each candidate based upon their availability and our potential for full-time openings. Internships will be no shorter than 8 weeks and no longer than 12 weeks.

LOCATION: In our commitment to work-life balance, our entire workforce is fully remote, as are our internships. Interns may work from wherever they have a solid internet connection and the ability to successfully complete internship learning and professional experiences.

HOURS: This is a 40-hour per week internship, with work hours falling within standard business hours, approximately M-F, 8/9am-5/6pm.

ABOUT THE INTERNS WE'RE SEEKING: We're looking for interns who may be: 1. Superstar college seniors (ideally graduated by December 2021, so they can commit to a full-time internship) or recent Bachelor’s Degree graduates with a major in Cybersecurity, Information Technology, Computer Science, or other related degrees, to gain hands-on experience with our fast-growing company in one of the most exciting and critical industries on earth – I.T. security; OR 2. Talented, driven folks with some college coursework or an Associate’s Degree in the aforementioned areas, as well as some real-world experience in I.T. Security and/or certifications.

We’re excited to interview internship candidates who are ready to jump in and be trained in our array of security assessment services, while also enjoying the chance to apply recent studies and test the professional waters at a nationally-recognized company known for its friendly team, positive culture, high client satisfaction, and cutting-edge industry leadership.

POTENTIAL FOR HIRE: Unlike many organizations, that bring in a slew of interns only to turn them out a few months later, at BAI, we only bring in the number of interns for whom we foresee the strong potential for a permanent opening. That way, our interns are learning from our team, but also working for a likely opportunity.

While we cannot guarantee a job offer at the end of an internship, we can say that 100% of our 2021 interns were offered and accepted permanent roles with us in IT Security, IT Compliance, and Marketing! As we DO anticipate openings in spring 2022 for the IT Security Team, these interns will have the rare chance to be exclusively considered for any openings before a competitive national search is conducted. As such, this is an exceptional opportunity to come in, learn, show us what you can do, and get to the “front of the line” for role consideration!

INTERN STATUS: This is an 8- to 12-week, temporary, unpaid internship with the potential, at the 8- to 12-week mark, of turning into a full-time, permanent position with an annual salary and top tier Blue Cross Blue Shield benefits eligibility at the 90-day employment mark (medical, dental, vision, life, and optional 401K).

I.T. SECURITY INTERNS WILL GAIN EXPERIENCE WITH:

Learning BAI Security’s services from a team of highly trained, certified, and experienced in-house experts
Learning how to evaluate an organization’s firewall and wireless configurations, as well as network and antivirus policies / procedures compared to current industry best practices
Performing vulnerability and/or penetration tests on client environments
Completing assessment work papers by documenting assessment tests and findings
Learning red team and social engineering methods (email [phishing], phone, and in-person) to apply in client evaluations
Understanding how to build strong partnerships with clients via service, frequent communication, and follow up
Learning how to identify and recommend opportunities where clients may reduce risk and improve their security posture
Producing well-written professional reports for executives and managers based upon assessment findings

ALL INTERNS ARE EXPECTED TO BE:

Foundationally knowledgeable in IT security but also eager to learn and apply in real-world engagements

Join Lumen's UX Team as we re-imagine and reinvent how large Telecoms can better interact with and support their customers in a way that is more modern, digital-first, intuitive, and friendly. Design user experiences used by millions of people everyday, take on complex tasks and transform them into intuitive, accessible and easy-to-use designs. Collaborate with teams of Designers, Researchers, Engineers and Product Managers throughout the design process—from creating user flows and wireframes to building user interface mockups and prototypes. At each stage, you will anticipate what our users need, advocate for them and ensure that the final product surprises and delights them. Bring your experience in Design Thinking and your pragmatic user-centered and data-informed design approach to create innovative, usable, great-looking products that people love to use.   We're looking for a UX Research Intern to help us make the performance of complex tasks an intuitive, elegant, and satisfying user experience. As part of a growing UX team you'll collaborate with multiple teams to create software for our customers that is powerful, feature-rich, yet easy to use. We value creative, self-driven individuals who care about the work they produce and the people they work with and we love a good sense of humor, too. The User Experience Research Intern will work with product design teams to identify research needs and deliver user-centered findings that help design useful, usable, and desirable user experiences.   JOB DESCRIPTION The ideal candidate for this role is a problem-solver and self-starter who effectively collaborates with other teams to deliver user-centric insights. The selected intern will help define and shape solutions that scale, using multiple research tools and techniques to uncover user insights. Your fellow researchers will provide you with support and mentorship.   RESPONSIBILITIES: - Conduct qualitative and quantitative research to help inform requirements and validate design decisions - Advocate for the user and champion the value of research as part of the decision-making process - Collaborate with our product managers, engineers, UX designers, and UX researchers to improve engagement and reduce friction across multiple digital products - Participate in multidisciplinary brainstorms, working sessions, and other collaborative discussions   WHAT WE LOOK FOR IN A CANDIDATE EDUCATION REQUIREMENTS: - Pursuing a Bachelor's or Master’s degree in Human-Computer Interaction, Cognitive Science, Communications, Psychology, Computer Science, or have other related experience. - Enrolled at a 4-year accredited college or university; junior or senior level education status at the start of the internship (graduating August 2022 – June 2023). PREFERRED EXPERIENCE: - Familiarity with Quantitative and Qualitative Research Methods - Have a passion for understanding and building empathy for humans - A portfolio and/or case studies demonstrating student work. - Experienced in data-gathering and analysis techniques across qualitative and quantitative methods - Able to multitask and work in a fast-paced, collaborative team environment - Excited to solve unique and challenging problems - Thrive on collaboration, working side by side with people of all backgrounds and disciplines, and have strong verbal and written communications PROFESSIONAL ATTRIBUTES: - Strong drive for results and taking initiative - Ability to be resourceful and adaptable - Ability to collaborate and have agility while making effective decisions   WHAT TO EXPECT NEXT After completion and submission of your application, you will be asked to participate in a virtual video interview. This on demand interview will be a way for Lumen to learn more about you and your experience as it aligns to the internship position.  A separate email invitation will be sent to you (check your spam) within 6 hours of application.  For continued consideration in the summer internship program, please ensure you complete the video interview within 5 business days of application.  Thank you!
